str2: From pro and a derivative of sphazo; previously slain, i.e. lately made.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To consecrate, dedicate, renovate. From egkainia; to renew, i.e. Inaugurate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of kata and a congener of petomai; something spread thoroughly, i.e. the door screen in the Jewish Temple.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
